raw_stats: see doc. "There, we computed the median distances from the centroid of the IAA samples (excluding the two Mediaeval samples), the Roman Imperials and the Republicans, obtain- ing 0.0093, 0.0140, and 0.0101, respectively. Notably, the dis- tance distributions were not statistically different, thus suggesting that the extent of genetic heterogeneity of IAA individuals is comparable to that of the cosmopolitan Republican and Imperial Roman samples, the latter having experienced a remarkable degree of admixture with foreign Mediterranean groups, pushed by strong geopolitical contin- gencies (Antonio et al. 2019)."
